oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lieutenant B. E. Robinson Sword
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sword (manufacturer unknown) and scabbard that belonged to Lieutenant B. E. Robinson, Company I, 95th Ohio Infantry. An eagle and "e pluribus unum" are engraved on one side of the blade. The 95th fought at Brice's Crossroads, a decisive victory for the Confederates, led by Nathan Bedford Forrest. Forrest captured most of the 95th's weapons and supplies.
